conversations.english: Have you moved into your new house yet, Michael?
conversations.chinese: 米歇尔,你搬进新房了吗？
conversations.reply_english: We just moved in yesterday, actually.
conversations.reply_chinese: 确切地说，我们是昨天刚刚搬进去的。

title: 有时候政府会向老百姓拍卖一些房子

conversations.english: Have you thought of moving at all Sarah?
conversations.chinese: 萨拉，你们究竟有没有想过搬家。
conversations.reply_english: We’ve thought about it, but my husband and I can’t afford it right now. The only thing we could afford would be living in the slums, which is something I don’t want to do.
conversations.reply_chinese: 想过。但是我们夫妻俩目前都还买不起。所以我们现在只能住在这个破破烂烂的地方，我真是不愿意待在这里。

title: 这地方可真不错 This is certainly a nice place

conversations.english: Well, this is certainly a nice place, Mr. Taylor. What sort of public transportation is nearby?
conversations.chinese: 哦，这个地方真不错，泰勒先生。附近有什么公交系统？
conversations.reply_english: Please, call my John. Well, there’s a subway stop and bus station just around the corner. Do you have children?
conversations.reply_chinese: 叫我约翰好了。嗯，附近有一个地铁站和一个公车站。你有小孩吗？

title: 最好的房子是朝南的 Purchasing a House

conversations.english: What a fine day! Oh, I can enjoy reading on this balcony in a fine day like this. I like it.
conversations.chinese: 天气真好！噢，我可以在像今天这样的好天气在阳台上看书了。我喜欢这阳台。
conversations.reply_english: The balcony is very beautiful, but I don't like the fact that it faces north.
conversations.reply_chinese: 阳台很漂亮，但是我不喜欢它朝北。
